That passion I'd felt during\nthe street performance hadn't faded.%K%P
Shuri Kisshouten. Her performance might\nhave been special, it might not.%K%P
I did not know enough about Divine Idols\nto make that judgment.%K%P
'Luckily, Akiba is the perfect place to learn.'%K%P
Going one street in from Akihabara's main\nthoroughfare, the way grew crowded with\nlots of different shops.%K%P
The area had been famous for maid cafes,\nand now Goddess Cafes were spreading.%K%P
Goddess Cafe 'Amano Kaguyama'. \nThe sign out front says 'Live Shows'.%K%P
'Welcome, thank you for coming!'%K%P
'Just you, sir? Just you, then! \nRight this way, please!'%K%P
The shopkeeper led me to a seat.%K%P
But I was thrown off by\nthe crazy outfit in front of me.%K%P
I knew that Divine Idols tended to show\na lot of skin, but even so, this was something else...%K%P
'Oh? Could this be your first time in a cafe\nlike this? We are a gen-u-ine, really real\nGoddess Cafe!'%K%P
'I-I wasn't doubting you...!'%K%P
But it was a little suspicious.%K%P
She was so bothered, she leaned in closer to talk.%K%P
And because of that, I got a bit more of a look\nthan I'd expected and grew even more embarrassed.%K%P
'I am Kagura Amauzu! \nI'm one of Ame no Uzume's Wakemitama...\nDo you know what that means?'%K%P
We call it the Descent, but it's not like the gods\nand goddesses just appeared in human form.%K%P
They divided their spirits into Wakemitama,\nand while each one is influenced by the\noriginal god, they aren't exact copies.%K%P
Each Wakemitama is different,\nwith their own looks and character.%K%P
She is one of Ame no Uzume's Wakemitama,\nbut she is a person of her own,\nwho is apparently called Kagura Amauzu.%K%P
'I know who Ame no Uzume is. \nIsn't she the goddess of entertainment?'%K%P
'Whoa! I think you're the first one who knew! \nToday's my lucky day!'%K%P
Ame no Uzume is not only the goddess of\nentertainment, but was also known for\nbeing fortunate.%K%P
But apparently, not many people know that these days.%K%P
Goddesses whose popularity is in decline and lose\nSakimitama often recover it by making their\nIdol debuts.%K%P
The Goddess Cafes of Akihabara are where\nthese hatchling Divine Idols can start\nto strut their stuff.%K%P
'Oh, but if we just stand here chatting I'll get in\ntrouble with the boss. Can I take your order?'%K%P
I took a look at the menu she handed me. \nIt all looked fairly ordinary, pretty much\nthe same as all the old maid cafes that filled Akiba.%K%P
'Uh, let's see... Iced coffee, I guess.'%K%P
She was clearly disappointed.%K%P
'Is that not a good idea?'%K%P
'No, no, it's fine... \nSure, okay. Iced coffee it is.'%K%P
'But, you know... You did come all the way\nto a Goddess Cafe... I mean, isn't iced coffee\njust a little... Plain?'%K%P
'So why don't you try our most popular item,\nthe Goddess Rice Omelet? I highly recommend it!♪'%K%P
'So how is that different from\na regular rice omelet?'%K%P
'A real-life goddess will write\na message on your omelet!'%K%P
'Is that all?'%K%P
'T-that's what you might think... But, it's a\ngoddess, you know? You'll get an amazing blessing\nfrom it! Better than the shogun's official seal!'%K%P
'Okay then, I'll have the Goddess Rice Omelet.'%K%P
'Yippee! One Goddess Rice Omelet, coming up!'%K%P
'One Goddess Rice Omelet, coming up!'%K%P
The entire staff repeated the order.%K%P
You might have thought that would attract attention,\nbut it didn't.%K%P
It was the most popular dish,\nafter all, so it wasn't exactly rare.%K%P
'Here you go! \nOne iced coffee and one Goddess Rice Omelet!'%K%P
She brought me my order,\nand started shaking a ketchup bottle.%K%P
'Well, then! What would you like me to write? \nAnything you want!'%K%P
If you can't think of anything right away,\nyou can leave it up to the goddess if you want!'%K%P
'Well, I guess I'll leave it to you then.'%K%P
'No problem! \nAlrighty then, here I go!'%K%P
Shaking the ketchup, her face went deadly serious.%K%P
It was a tranquil moment, like the moment before\na calligrapher lowers her brush to the paper.%K%P
'It's soo cuuuuute♪,\n yummy yummyyy♪'%K%P
'What, that's it?!'%K%P
'Now, now... The real show is coming up.\nWatch closely!'%K%P
The stale atmosphere suddenly changed,\nand a frigid wind arose.%K%P
The ketchup bottle waved above the omelet\nlike the scepter of a Shinto priest.%K%P
I was so swept up in that sight that I almost missed\nthe faint light that started dancing above\nthe rice omelet.%K%P
'So... This is a Goddess Rice Omelet.'%K%P
In her presence, I reflexively\nsat up straighter. Although she seemed like a bit\nof a ditz, this girl was, after all, a goddess.%K%P
'Alright, all dooone! \nOne Goddess Rice Omelet, to perfection!'%K%P
'Since you left the message up to me,\nI just wrote my signature! \nIf you like, you could become my fan!'%K%P
'I-I can't read it...'%K%P
'Heheh, the ketchup smeared,\nso it's kind of hard to read. \nOkay, I'll draw some hearts for free!'%K%P
She added a few hearts. It was an even bigger mess,\nbut to be honest, I didn't mind.%K%P
'Okay, relax and enjoy yourself now!'%K%P
She left me with my Goddess-signed Rice Omelet.%K%P
It certainly looked blessed,\nbut I wondered about the taste.%K%P
It tasted like a perfectly ordinary\nRice Omelet with a lot of ketchup.%K%P
While I enjoyed my after-meal iced coffee,\nI looked around the Goddess Cafe.%K%P
All the cute idol-dreaming goddesses\nseemed to be having fun while they worked.%K%P
Apart from their magic, they didn't really\nseem any different from human girls.%K%P
'Okay everyone, the wait is over! \nIt's time for our stage show!'%K%P
The lights went down,\nand a spotlight hit the tiny stage.%K%P
Then loud music started playing. \nIt was the intro to an L☆SEVEN song.%K%P
'Hellooo Everyone!'%K%P
'Hellooo!'%K%P
'I'm everyone's favorite goddess, Kagura Amauzu! \nYeeaah!'%K%P
A few Divine Idols appeared, centered around Kagura.%K%P
'I want to welcome our first timers,\nand of course our regulars, to our show today! \nCome on everybody, let's have some fun!'%K%P
Suddenly all the customers,\nwho had been sitting quietly so far,\nrushed up in front of the stage.%K%P
They all gripped multicolored glow sticks,\nand were cheering for their favorite goddess.%K%P
'Alriiight! 'Thank you so much! \nHey there Mr. Hellhound, and you too, Rice Balldy!'%K%P
The goddesses waved at the fans\nthey recognized from the stage.%K%P
I'm sure the fans were overjoyed\nat this close-up interaction.%K%P
'But even then...What's up with that?'%K%P
There was something going on with the goddesses\naround Kagura.%K%P
Maybe it was because Kagura's outfit was so skimpy,\nbut whenever she made any big movements\nthey covered her.%K%P
I'm sure she was wearing something under there,\nbut our eyes kept glancing around,\ntrying to catch a glimpse.%K%P
'Kaguraaa! You're so cute! \nCome on, give us some more!'%K%P
'Hahahah, thank you! \nBut you know I can't show you any more than this!'%K%P
The goddesses guarding Kagura\nall nodded in agreement.%K%P
It appeared all of this was normal here.%K%P
'Alright, here we gooo!'%K%P
With the warm-up talk finished,\nit was finally time for the song to start.%K%P
The crowd's eyes were fixated on Kagura,\nsinging and dancing with all her heart.%K%P
'Yeah! Yeah! Yeah!'%K%P
'Oooookaaaay! I'm fiiiired up!'%K%P
'Kagura!'%K%P
'Okay everybody, let's keep going!'%K%P
I felt a sense of unity with this show far beyond\nwhat I'd had watching Shuri's street performance\nearlier.%K%P
Kagura was the center of the action,\nbut the others sang and danced right with her.%K%P
It overflowed with the power of a group performance,\nsomething far different from a solo artist.%K%P
Everyone gave their whole attention to the\nperformance, and the girls all watched the\naudience as well.%K%P
The whole shop became one stage,\nand everyone was united in the show.%K%P
Just like the others, I was on my feet,\nfists in the air.%K%P
'Ohhh...You are all so great! \nThis is the best show ever!'%K%P
During breaks in the singing,\nKagura kept calling out to the audience.%K%P
The dancing kept getting more furious,\nand we in the audience grew more deeply enthralled.%K%P
Gradually, they blocked less and less of Kagura's\nskin, and the more we saw, the more thrilled we got.%K%P
The glances of her bare skin were captivating,\nbut strangely it was less erotic than it had been\nbefore the show started.%K%P
The singing, the dancing, and this outfit... \nThe three became one, all part of the show.%K%P
And then, as the energy uniting the stage\nand the audience reached its maximum,\nKagura exploded into emotion.%K%P
'Thank you so much, everyone! I love you all!'%K%P
As her hands touched her costume,\nit began to unfold like great wings.%K%P
'Huh? Wait...'%K%P
Her costume, already skimpy,\nbecame even more revealing.%K%P
She rushed to cover the vital bits,\nbut barely made it.%K%P
'Woohoooo! Kagura's taking it oofff!'%K%P
The crowd went wild. And what's more, it was like\nher stripping was almost to be expected.%K%P
No one tried to rush the stage,\nbut everyone was focused solely on her.%K%P
'Yeeeaaaaah! Woooooo!'%K%P
She and the crowd grew more fervent as one.%K%P
'Time for me to kick it up a notch!'%K%P
Again, her hands went over her costume.%K%P
Was she seriously going to take more off? \nIf she did, there'd be no way to cover\nwhat needed covering!%K%P
'Theeere!'%K%P
And she flung her arms open.%K%P
The other goddesses rushed to cover her,\nbut there was no way they'd make it!%K%P
'Stooop!!'%K%P
I jumped on stage by reflex.%K%P
I stood in front of Kagura\nto hide her from the audience.%K%P
'What are you doing, taking your clothes off\nin front of everyone? Girls shouldn't do that!'%K%P
'Huh? Oh, yeah... Um, sorry.'%K%P
Kagura thanked me with a puzzled look on her face.%K%P
'Wh-what am I doing?'%K%P
I was supposed to be here watching Divine Idols\nputting on a show, but there I was, rushing the stage\nand completely destroying the mood.%K%P
I got a thorough talking to in the back room,\nand then finally they let me go.%K%P
'I'm just glad I didn't get banned.'%K%P
'No, you're fine. I hope you come again.'%K%P
'Ms. Amauzu?'%K%P
Kagura appeared before me, dressed in her uniform.%K%P
'Please, call me Kagura. And you are...?'%K%P
'Yamato Tatsumi.\nI'm really sorry about what happened just now.'%K%P
I apologized again for ruining her performance.%K%P
'You don't need to apologize so much. \nThat kind of stuff happens all the time.'%K%P
Apparently her show gets stopped quite often\nbecause of her stripping.%K%P
If I hadn't got on stage and stopped her,\nit would have probably ended the same way anyway.%K%P
'Whenever the show really gets going like that,\nI just end up taking off my clothes. \nThe manager always chews me out for it.'%K%P
'I mean, I am Ame no Uzume's Wakemitama, after all. \nSo of course when everyone's happy and having fun,\nI'm just like 'woo hoo!' and let it all go.'%K%P
'In this day and age, of course, that kind of stuff\nis frowned on, but when I get up on stage\nI forget all that.'%K%P
They say that when Amaterasu got angry and hid\nin the Amano-Iwato cave, Ame no Uzume had danced\nand taken off her clothes to make her come out.%K%P
Since Kagura is a Wakemitama for a goddess like that,\nit's only natural she'd be influenced by that part of\nthe goddess' nature.%K%P
'That's dangerous! \nAre you sure you'll be okay?'%K%P
'Nope, totally not gonna be okay. I cause all kinds\nof problems for the others, and always get in trouble\nwith my boss... I bet she'll dock me again.'%K%P
'Oh! But you went up on stage today!'%K%P
'You took the brunt of the boss' anger,\nso I'm in the clear this time! Eheh!'%K%P
'What do you mean, 'eheh!''%K%P
She's glad I got in trouble instead of her.%K%P
Oh well, I guess if I was able to protect her\n(and her pay), there's some relief there.%K%P
'Eheheh, sorry.'%K%P
'Please don't pay it any mind. \nAt least it did some good.'%K%P
'Hmmm...'%K%P
Kagura stared at me with a troubled look,\nlike something was bothering her.%K%P
'W-What is it?'%K%P
'We're outside the shop now,\nso you can cut that out.'%K%P
'What exactly do you mean by 'that'?'%K%P
'THAT. Your mister formality stuff. \nYou can talk normal to me, like friends do.'%K%P
'Oh... Uh, if that's what you want...Kagura. Gotcha.'%K%P
'Thanks!'%K%P
When I lightened my tone, Kagura seemed pleased.%K%P
She had seemed cheerful working at the Goddess Cafe,\nbut now she actually seemed more relaxed and happier.%K%P
Meaning, this must be the real Kagura Amauzu.%K%P
'I'll remember you, Yamato. Next time, be sure\nto watch all the way to the end, okay?'%K%P
And with those words, Kagura disappeared\ninto the Akiba streets.%K%P
